title: Huawei calls US move to blacklist more affiliates 'unjust' and 'politically motivated'
text: The U.S. extended Huawei's license by 90 days, but also added more affiliates of the telecommunications giant onto the Entity List.

title: Oil prices slip, but supported by hopes trade tensions could ease
text: Crude oil prices slipped on Tuesday, but losses were limited as equity markets rallied and as traders hoped Sino-U.S. trade tensions would ease.

title: Asian shares nudge higher on stimulus hopes, recession fears ease
text: Asian shares extended their gains on Tuesday as hopes for stimulus in major economies tempered anxiety about a global recession, helping boost riskier assets and drawing money from safe-havens such as bonds and gold.

title: Bull or Bear? Watch This Clue
text: We’re moving closer to a bear market, but for now, we’re expecting the markets to climb higher Last week had some rough spots. Watching the markets convulse on Wednesday was uncomfortable at best.

title: Bonds Retreat but Market Still Shows Anxiety
text: Bond prices pulled back, but nervous investors bought into the dip. Bellwether stocks display the conflict between buyers and sellers.

title: Cramer on why investors should follow earnings over the bond market
text: "I explained over and over again: you get a much better read on the economy by listening to the conference calls of individual large companies," Jim Cramer says.

title: Retailers shift along with generational change tastes: Cramer
text: "These days, the consumer is addicted to convenience ... If it doesn't have a great digital presence or incredible bargains, take a pass," Jim Cramer says.

title: Dow Jones Today: Trump’s Twitter Targets the Fed … Again

The Dow Jones Industrial Average started the week higher by 0.96% with just two of its 30 components finishing lower on the day.

title: Wall Street Rallies Monday
text: U.S. stocks were in the green on Monday after President Trump tweeted that the U.S. is “doing very well with China" in regard to trade talks. The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained 1.08% to 26,163, the S&P 500 index jumped 1.36% to 2,927 and the Nasdaq Composite Index advanced 1.47% to 8,011.

title: Oil rises 2% after attack on Saudi field, stimulus expectations
